proj3

Class HashedRBTs<AnyType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • proj3.HashedRBTs<AnyType>
  • Type Parameters:
    AnyType - this class is generic

    public class HashedRBTs<AnyType>
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    04.04.14

    This class processes a text file with the format Node [word="word", frequency=x] (where x is an integer) and hashes the results. It contains a table of self-balancing (red black) binary trees. The trees contain nodes with the first two letters of any word found. The object storing the first two letters also contains a heap of the actual words that start with those letters, sorted by frequency

    Author:
    rachaelbirky

      Constructors

      HashedRBTs(int size)
      HashedRBT:\n constructor, creates a new instance of this class with its own table of red black trees containing partials containing heaps

        public HashedRBTs(int size)
        HashedRBT:\n constructor, creates a new instance of this class with its own table of red black trees containing partials containing heaps
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • fileReader

        public void fileReader(java.lang.String filename)

        Method: fileReader

        Description: parses the given file to extract each word and frequency. converts the ASCII value of the first letter to the appropriate index of the hash table. accesses the tree at that index and checks to see if there is an existing partial into which the word node can be added. If one does not exist, it creates a new one with the word.

        Parameters:
        filename: - file to be parsed

      • printHashCountResults

        public void printHashCountResults()

        Method: printHashCountResults

        Description: prints the root of each tree in the hash table

      • retreiveHashedRBTat

        public RedBlackTree<Partial> retreiveHashedRBTat(int i)

        Method: retreiveHashedRBTat

        Description: when given an integer, this function returns the binary tree stored in that index of the hash table

        Parameters:
        i: - index of tree to be returned
        Returns:
        the tree at index i
